details.title: Radial basis function neural network for pulse radar detection

authors.affiliation: SPANN Lab., Indian Inst. of Technol., Bombay
authors.name: D.G. Khairnar

authors.affiliation: SPANN Lab., Indian Inst. of Technol., Bombay
authors.name: S.N. Merchant

authors.affiliation: SPANN Lab., Indian Inst. of Technol., Bombay
authors.name: U.B. Desai

details.abstract: A new approach using a radial basis function network (RBFN) for pulse compression is proposed. In the study, networks using 13-element Barker code, 35-element Barker code and 21-bit optimal sequences have been implemented. In training these networks, the RBFN-based learning algorithm was used. Simulation results show that RBFN approach has significant improvement in error convergence speed (very low training error), superior signal-to-sidelobe ratios, good noise rejection performance, improved misalignment performance, good range resolution ability and improved Doppler shift performance compared to other neural network approaches such as back-propagation, extended Kalman filter and autocorrelation function based learning algorithms. The proposed neural network approach provides a robust mean for pulse radar tracking

ieee.title: A robust neural network based pulse radar detection for weak signals
ieee.displayText: Aditya V. Padaki, Koshy George, "A robust neural network based pulse radar detection for weak signals", Radar Conference 2010 IEEE, pp. 1305-1310, 2010, ISSN 1097-5659.

ieee.title: Detection of snow clutter in ATC ground radar signal
ieee.displayText: Laura Pierucci, Leonardo Bocchi, Giuseppe Anania, Dionisio Acciai, "Detection of snow clutter in ATC ground radar signal", Radar Conference 2008. RADAR '08. IEEE, pp. 1-5, 2008, ISSN 1097-5659.

ieee.title: An efficient hybrid adaptive pulse compression approach to radar detection
ieee.displayText: Vikas Baghel, Ankita Panda, Ganapati Panda, "An efficient hybrid adaptive pulse compression approach to radar detection", Signal Processing and Communication (ICSC) 2013 International Conference on, pp. 335-339, 2013.

ieee.title: Sidelobe suppression algorithm for chaotic FM signal based on neural network
ieee.displayText: QinYan Tan, Yaoliang Song, "Sidelobe suppression algorithm for chaotic FM signal based on neural network", Signal Processing 2008. ICSP 2008. 9th International Conference on, pp. 2429-2433, 2008.

ieee.title: Improving Performance in Neural Network Based Pulse Compression for Binary and Polyphase Codes
ieee.displayText: Aditya V. Padaki, Koshy George, "Improving Performance in Neural Network Based Pulse Compression for Binary and Polyphase Codes", Computer Modelling and Simulation (UKSim) 2010 12th International Conference on, pp. 278-283, 2010.

ieee.title: Coherent Detection of Swerling 0 Targets in Sea-Ice Weibull-Distributed Clutter Using Neural Networks
ieee.displayText: Raúl Vicen-Bueno, Manuel Rosa-Zurera, María Pilar Jarabo-Amores, David de la Mata-Moya, "Coherent Detection of Swerling 0 Targets in Sea-Ice Weibull-Distributed Clutter Using Neural Networks", Instrumentation and Measurement IEEE Transactions on, vol. 59, pp. 3139-3151, 2010, ISSN 0018-9456.

ieee.title: An efficient multi-objective pulse radar compression technique using RBF and NSGA-II
ieee.displayText: Vikas Baghel, G. Panda, P. Srihari, K. Rajarajeswari, B. Majhi, "An efficient multi-objective pulse radar compression technique using RBF and NSGA-II", Nature & Biologically Inspired Computing 2009. NaBIC 2009. World Congress on, pp. 1291-1296, 2009.

ieee.title: Improvements of radar clutter classification in air traffic control environment
ieee.displayText: Laura Pierucci, Leonardo Bocchi, "Improvements of radar clutter classification in air traffic control environment", Signal Processing and Information Technology 2007 IEEE International Symposium on, pp. 721-724, 2007.

ieee.title: Detection of Ships in Marine Environments by Square Integration Mode and Multilayer Perceptrons
ieee.displayText: Raúl Vicen-Bueno, Rubén Carrasco-Alvarez, María Pilar Jarabo-Amores, José Carlos Nieto-Borge, Enrique Alexandre-Cortizo, "Detection of Ships in Marine Environments by Square Integration Mode and Multilayer Perceptrons", Instrumentation and Measurement IEEE Transactions on, vol. 60, pp. 712-724, 2011, ISSN 0018-9456.

ieee.title: A Novel Application of Support Vector Machines to Detect Targets
ieee.displayText: Aditya V. Padaki, Koshy George, "A Novel Application of Support Vector Machines to Detect Targets", Computational Intelligence Modelling and Simulation (CIMSiM) 2010 Second International Conference on, pp. 3-8, 2010.
